holidays.name: National Ice Cream Sandwich Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to celebrating the perfect cool-and-sweet treat: the ice cream sandwich. Whether it's the classic vanilla between chocolate cookies or a wacky new flavor combo, it's all about chilly indulgence!
holidays.origin: Became popular in the USA as ice cream sandwiches gained nostalgic popularity, celebrated unofficially by ice cream aficionados.
holidays.funFact: The ice cream sandwich dates back to early 1900s in New York, sold by street vendors as a sidewalk treat.

holidays.name: World UFO Day
holidays.description: A day to ponder extraterrestrial visitors and all things unidentified flying objects. UFO enthusiasts gather to discuss alien phenomena, watch sci-fi, and maybe even scan the skies.
holidays.origin: Started by UFO research groups to promote awareness of UFO sightings and extraterrestrial life.
holidays.funFact: August 2 marks the anniversary of the alleged Roswell UFO crash in 1947.

holidays.name: International Beer Day
holidays.description: Raise your glass! This day is all about appreciating beer, brewers, and beer lovers worldwide. Perfect excuse to cheers with friends over a cold one.
holidays.origin: Launched in 2007 to celebrate beer culture and encourage enjoying beer responsibly.
holidays.funFact: International Beer Day is celebrated on the first Friday of August, often falling on or near August 2.

holidays.name: National Coloring Book Day
holidays.description: Dust off those crayons and markers because it’s time to celebrate the artistic (and sometimes borderline therapeutic) joy of coloring books for all ages.
holidays.origin: An unofficial holiday aimed at encouraging creativity, stress relief, and fun through coloring.
holidays.funFact: Adult coloring books have become a multimillion-dollar industry because of their mental wellness benefits.
